refnamediv.refpurpose: Displays all users or groups in the Protection Database

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The pts listentries command displays the name and AFS ID of all Protection Database entries of the indicated type. It also displays the AFS ID of each entry's owner and creator.

To display all user and machine entries, either include the -users flag or omit both it and the -groups flag. To display all group entries, include the -groups flag. To display all entries, provide both flags.

listitem.para: Names the cell in which to run the command. For more details, see pts(1).
Assigns the unprivileged identity anonymous to the issuer. For more details, see pts(1).
Enables the command to continue executing as far as possible when errors or other problems occur, rather than halting execution at the first error.
Prints the online help for this command. All other valid options are ignored.

refsect1.title: Output
refsect1.para: The output includes a line for each entry, with information in four columns that have the following headers:

listitem.para: The entry's AFS ID (AFS UID for a user or machine, negative AFS GID for a group).
The AFS ID of the user or group that owns the entry.

The AFS ID of the user who created the entry (the system:administrators group is listed as the creator of the entry for anonymous and the system groups, but it is not otherwise possible for a group to create groups).

refsect1.para: In general, the entries appear in the order in which they were created.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following example displays both user and group entries.
refsect1.programlisting: % pts listentries -users -groups Name ID Owner Creator system:administrators -204 -204 -204 system:anyuser -101 -204 -204 system:authuser -102 -204 -204 anonymous 32766 -204 -204 admin 1 -204 32766 pat 100 -204 1 smith 101 -204 1 pat:friends -206 100 100 staff -207 -204 1

refsect1.title: Privilege Required
refsect1.para: The issuer must belong to the system:administrators group.
